meanings.definition: Resembling a scab in appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: The old paint on the wall had a scablike roughness to it.
meanings.sent2: Her sunburned skin felt scablike to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The scablike crust on the burnt toast made it hard to chew.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building had scablike patches of peeling paint.
meanings.sent5: The scablike scuff marks on the floor showed years of neglect.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a scab.
meanings.sent1: The wound was healing well, with a scablike covering forming over it.
meanings.sent2: The scablike scarring on his knee reminded him of the bike accident.
meanings.sent3: The scablike appearance of the dried glue on the table was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The scablike texture of the callus on her hand protected it from further damage.
meanings.sent5: The scablike edges of the torn paper gave it a rugged look.

meanings.definition: Covered with or consisting of scabs.
meanings.sent1: The scablike sores on his arm were a result of the allergic reaction.
meanings.sent2: The scablike patches on the dog's fur indicated a skin condition.
meanings.sent3: The scablike appearance of the dried mud on his shoes made them hard to clean.
meanings.sent4: The scablike bumps on the tree bark were caused by a fungal infection.
meanings.sent5: The scablike spots on the apple made it unappealing to eat.
